clinical_study.brief_title: Non-Invasive Characterization of Focal Liver Lesions in Liver Cirrhosis
clinical_study.official_title: Non-Invasive Characterization of Focal Liver Lesions in Liver Cirrhosis

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to analyze non-invasive characterization focal liver lesions in patients with liver cirrhosis. The diagnostic accuracy and predictive value of non-invasive methods is studied.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study aims to analyze non-invasive characterization focal liver lesions in patients with liver cirrhosis. The diagnostic accuracy and predictive value of non-invasive methods is studied.
Upon diagnosis multiparametric ultrasound imaging of the lesions as well as sarcopenia parameters are performed for characterization of the lesions. For primary endpoint the results are then analyzed with regard to diagnostic accuracy compared to gold standard (CT, MRI or histology). For secondary endpoint, predictive value of the non-invasive diagnostics are analyzed with regards to mortality and response to treatment.
All work up, treatment and follow up are applied in standard of care fashion.

primary_outcome.description: The diagnostic accuracy of non-invasive imaging of focal liver lesions in liver cirrhosis compared to gold standard (histology, CT and/or MRI)

secondary_outcome.description: The predictive value on mortality and treatment response of non-invasive imaging of focal liver lesions in liver cirrhosis

intervention.description: B-Mode ultrasound, Duplex sonography, contrast-enhanced ultrasound, elastography, CT, MRI, anthropometrics

study_pop.textblock: This study includes all adult patients in our institution with liver cirrhosis and diagnosis of focal liver lesions. Non-invasive charaterization (multiparametric ultrasound, sarcopenia assessment) and standard of care work up, treatment and follow up is applied to all patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients with focal liver lesions and liver cirrhosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- no consent
- under 18 years
